pr_title: FM2-193: Generate default narratives provided by HAPI FHIR

timeline.bodyText: Constants should be UPPER_CASE. Also, we have a FhirConstants class for holding this type of information.
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText:
Please don't do this this way. The problem here is that you're hard-coding the FhirContext which is actually being set by Spring (see above). The correct thing to do here would be to replace where you have the call to this.setDefaultNarrativeGenerator() with the last line of code:
getFhirContext().setNarrativeGenerator(new CustomThymeleafNarrativeGenerator(hapiDefaultNarrativesPropFile));
That way, it only depends on the FhirContext that is set by Spring, so that we don't break support for DSTU3 while doing this.
It might also be worth thinking about if we could load the ThymeleafNarrativeGenerator from Spring, as this might give us more flexibility in defining the property files to load, instead of needing to know about them ahead of time.
timeline.author: ibacher
